task.title: Change the Typewriter Ribbon
task.shortdesc: To maintain your typewriter, you will need to change the ink ribbon inside the machine. Changing the ribbon will ensure that you have fresh ink for all your writing aspirations!

substep.cmd: Gently lift the front edge of the ribbon cover until it is fully opened.
Slowly lift one of the ribbon spools from its metal spool holder.
Gently pull the ribbon upwards and out of the auto-reversing bracket.
Repeat the above two steps for the second ribbon spool.
Locate the set of ribbon guides that are in front of the ribbon vibrator.
Carefully unthread the existing ribbon through the small slits in the ribbon guides.

step.cmd: Step 3: Place new typewriter ribbon spools on spool shafts

substep.cmd: Place one of the new ribbon spools onto the ribbon spool shaft so that the spool shaft pin fits into the designated slot on the new ribbon spool.
Ensure that the ribbon coming off of the spool is directed toward the back of the typewriter and is not twisted.
Carefully slide the ribbon into the auto-reverse bracket directly next to the metal spool shaft.
Repeat for the other ribbon spool.
Take the ribbon between each spool and feed it through the small slots on each side of the ribbon guide, taking care to not stretch the ribbon.
Gently rotate each ribbon spool so that the ribbon is taut, but not tightened too much.

step.cmd: Step 5: Clean typewriter interior and hands

substep.note: Enter cautionary note about this step here.
substep.cmd: Carefully wipe any excess ink off of the interior of the typewriter.
Clean your hands or remove your gloves.
Gently push the ribbon cover down until it is fully closed.

substep.note: The letters may look smudgy at first, this is normal and likely due to excessive ink coming off of the ribbon during the installation process. It should resolve after typing a sentence or two.
substep.cmd: Type out a few words to ensure the ribbon ink is installed and working as desired.
